#Text=Stranger Things Happen -
#Text=Water Off a Black Dog ’s Back
#Text=Rachel Rook took Carroll home to meet her parents two months after she first slept with him .
#Text=For a generous girl , a girl who took off her clothes with abandon , she was remarkably close - mouthed about some things .
#Text=In two months Carroll had learned that her parents lived on a farm several miles outside of town ; that they sold strawberries in summer , and Christmas trees in the winter .
#Text=He knew that they never left the farm ; instead , the world came to them in the shape of weekend picnickers and driveby tourists .
#Text=Do you think your parents will like me ? " he said .

#Text= No , " she said .

column1: #Text=It was the first time she had been to his apartment , and she stood square in the center of his bedroom , her arms folded against her body as if she was afraid to sit down , to touch something .
#Text=" Why ? "
#Text=" My father will like you , " she said .
#Text=" But he likes everyone .

#Text= So you 've talked to her about me . "

column1: #Text=" Yes . "
#Text=" But you have n't talked about her to me . "
#Text=" No . "
#Text=" Are you ashamed of her ? "
#Text=Rachel snorted .
#Text=Then she sighed in a way that seemed to suggest she was regretting her decision to take him home .
#Text=" You 're ashamed of me , " he guessed , and Rachel kissed him and smiled and did n't say anything .
#Text=Rachel still lived on her parents ' farm , which made it all the more remarkable that she had kept Carroll and her parents apart for so long .
#Text=It suggested a talent for daily organization that filled Carroll 's heart with admiration and lust .

#Text=She was nineteen , two years younger than Carroll ; she was a student at Jellicoh College and every weekday she rose at seven and biked four miles into town , and then back again on her bike , four miles uphill to the farm .
#Text=Carroll met Rachel in the Jellicoh College library , where he had a part - time job .
#Text=He sat at the checkout desk , stamping books and reading Tristram Shandy for a graduate class ; he was almost asleep when someone said , " Excuse me . "
#Text=He looked up .
#Text=The girl who stood before the tall desk was red - headed .
#Text=Sunlight streaming in through a high window opposite her lit up the fine hairs on her arm , the embroidered flowers on the collar of her white shirt .
#Text=The sunlight turned her hair to fire and Carroll found it difficult to look directly at her .
#Text=" Can I help you ? " he said .
#Text=She placed a shredded rectangle on the desk , and Carroll picked it up between his thumb and forefinger .
#Text=Pages hung in tatters from the sodden blue spine .
#Text=Title , binding , and covers had been gnawed away .
#Text=" I need to pay for a damaged book , " she said .
#Text=" What happened ? Did your dog eat it ? " he said , making a joke .
#Text=" Yes , " she said , and smiled .
#Text=" What 's your name ? " Carroll said .
#Text=Already , he thought he might be in love .
